meanings.definition: The quality or state of being florid.
meanings.sent1: The floridities of the garden's flowers brought joy to all.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with unnecessary floridities, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: The floridities of the cake decoration made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His writing was a garden of floridities, blooming with colorful descriptions.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the floridities of nature in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Excessive elaborateness or ornamentation in style, speech, or action.
meanings.sent1: The floridities of the costume made it stand out in the play.
meanings.sent2: The floridities in his writing distracted from the main point of the story.
meanings.sent3: The floridities of her dance moves entertained the audience.
meanings.sent4: The floridities of the building's architecture reflected the opulence of the era.
meanings.sent5: The floridities of the speech left the audience feeling overwhelmed.
